vision.notes: Presence of eyes is common in terrestrial snails, although visual acuity is likely limited to light/dark detection and gross object recognition. Used in navigation and predator avoidance.

chemoreception.notes: Snails rely heavily on chemoreception for finding food, mates, and suitable habitats. They possess chemoreceptors on their tentacles and other body parts.

mechanoreception.notes: Snails are sensitive to vibrations and touch through mechanoreceptors in their foot and other tissues. This helps them detect predators and navigate their environment.
